extraction_steps: Power off the device and remove any external casing or SIM trays
Unscrew the back panel screws (usually using a pentalobe or Phillips screwdriver)
Use a plastic prying tool to detach the back cover
Disconnect any flex cables or connectors attached to the camera
Unscrew and lift the camera module from the motherboard
hazards: Handle lens carefully to avoid breakage
Beware of sharp internal components when prying
Camera.recycling_info: Can be resold, reused in DIY projects, or sent to e-waste facilities for specialized recovery

extraction_steps: Ensure the device is powered off and the back cover is removed
Locate the battery connector and disconnect it from the motherboard
If adhesive is present, gently pull the tabs or use isopropyl alcohol to weaken it
Use a plastic tool to lift the battery slowly from the enclosure
hazards: Avoid bending or puncturing to prevent thermal runaway or fire
Do not short-circuit the battery terminals
Battery.recycling_info: Must be disposed of at an authorized e-waste or battery recycling center

extraction_steps: Usually removed after camera and battery have been taken out
Use a heat gun or hairdryer to loosen adhesive around the screen edges
Slide a plastic card or prying tool around the edges to separate the LCD
Disconnect the screen connector from the motherboard
hazards: Fragile glass â€“ wear protective gloves and eye protection
Potential for cuts from cracked screens
LCD Screen.recycling_info: LCD panels contain rare elements and should be handled by certified recycling centers

extraction_steps: Should be done after removing battery and camera modules
Disconnect all remaining connectors and screws holding the board
Lift the motherboard out using plastic tweezers or lifting tool
hazards: Avoid applying force to prevent breaking connectors
Motherboard.recycling_info: Contains valuable metals like gold, silver, copper; best processed by specialized recyclers
